label: Blog Posts
description: Blog posts are the content that makes up your site. If you're a technical person, they use MDX format and support JSX components.
name: posts

fields.label: Title
fields.name: title
fields.hint: Use an attention-grabbing title and keep this to 50-60 characters or shorter for best results (examples here: https://tinyurl.com/post-title-ideas). Template tag for this setting: {contentTitle}

fields.label: Slug
fields.name: rawSlug
fields.hint: Used in the URL of the post. For instance, if the slug is "hello-world", the post would be viewable at https://mysite.com/hello-world. Must be unique. Only use lowercase letters, dashes, and underscores.

fields.label: Publish Date
fields.name: date
fields.hint: This is the date shown for the post, and is used to sort posts chronologically. You can hide the date using the option below. Setting a date in the future will cause that post to be hidden until then.

fields.label: Category
fields.name: category
fields.hint: If you don't want the post to be categorized, set this to none. Otherwise, set this to anything. Other posts with the same category will be grouped together. Template tag for this setting: {contentCategory}

fields.label: Custom Excerpt
fields.name: customExcerpt
fields.hint: Specify a custom excerpt here, or set to none to automatically use the first few sentences of the post. Template tag for this setting: {contentExcerpt}

fields.label: Use Featured Image
fields.name: featuredImageEnabled
fields.hint: When disabled, the featured image will not be shown for the post. Using a featured image is HIGHLY recommended.

fields.label: Featured Image
fields.name: featuredImageUrl
fields.hint: Recommended size is 1200x630 (1.91:1), and under 5MB. You can use Canva to edit, and can grab a free image here: https://www.pexels.com/

fields.label: Featured Image Alt
fields.name: featuredImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom image. This is used for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up. Supports template tags. Set to none to disable.

fields.label: Show Sidebar
fields.name: showSidebar
fields.hint: You can show the sidebar for specific posts if you'd like.

fields.label: Hide Post
fields.name: hidden
fields.hint: If you hide a post, it won't be visible to users on the site.

fields.label: Show Date
fields.name: dateEnabled
fields.hint: When disabled, the date will not be shown for the post.

fields.label: Enable Discussion
fields.name: discussionEnabled
fields.hint: When disabled, the comments section will not be shown.

fields.label: Enable Sharing
fields.name: sharingEnabled
fields.hint: When disabled, the social media sharing buttons will not be shown.

fields.label: Facebook Quote
fields.name: facebookQuote
fields.hint: Quote to use when sharing via the Facebook button. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Facebook Hashtag
fields.name: facebookHashtag
fields.hint: You can use a Facebook hashtag if you'd like. Be sure to include the # character. Set to none for no hashtag.

fields.label: Twitter Title
fields.name: twitterTitle
fields.hint: Title shown when sharing via the Twitter button. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Twitter Via
fields.name: twitterVia
fields.hint: The attribution for the shared content on Twitter. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Twitter Hashtags
fields.name: twitterHashtags
fields.hint: Hashtags for the content. Set to none for no hashtags.

fields.label: SEO Title
fields.name: seoTitle
fields.hint: The title shown in the browser tab and in Google search results. Use an attention-grabbing title and keep this to 50-60 characters or shorter for best results. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentSeoTitle}

fields.label: SEO Description
fields.name: seoDescription
fields.hint: A description of the content. Can also be an excerpt, if you want. At least two sentences long is recommended, and it should entice users to click. Use {computedPostSeoDescription} for the site-wide title computed from Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentSeoDescription}

fields.label: SEO Image
fields.name: seoImage
fields.hint: ↑ Select the image used when sharing. Unless customized below, this will be used as the Open Graph and Twitter Card image when sharing the page.

fields.label: SEO Image Used
fields.name: seoImageSelection
fields.hint: Specify which image should be used for SEO. ⮞ Featured Image (If Enabled): The featured image will be used for SEO. If "Featured Image » Use Featured Image" is disabled, it will fall back to the site-wide image specifed in Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. ⮞ Custom Image: The image specified below will be used for SEO. Choose this option if you want a different SEO image from the featured or fallback site-wide one.

fields.label: Custom SEO Image
fields.name: customSeoImage
fields.hint: To use a custom SEO image, you must select Use Custom Image above. Select an image that's bigger than 1200×630 and looks good when cropped into a square. Facebook recommends a 1200×630 (1.91:1) and will crop the top and bottom of larger images. Reddit will crop and resize images to 70×70. Twitter Cards can use either square or wide images depending on the card type being used, but the default is a square. Use a different URL for new images or the image won't be updated by Facebook.

fields.label: Custom SEO Image Alt
fields.name: customSeoImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom image. This is used for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Open Graph
fields.name: openGraph
fields.hint: ↑ Settings for Open Graph, a protocol that allows you to specify the information to show when someone shares your page.

fields.label: OG Title
fields.name: ogTitle
fields.hint: The title shown when someone shares your page. Use {siteWidePostOgTitle} for the computed OG title from Site-Wide SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentOgTitle}

fields.label: OG Description
fields.name: ogDescription
fields.hint: The description shown when someone shares your page. At least two sentences long is recommended, and it should entice users to click.  Use {siteWidePostOgDescription} for the computed OG description from Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentOgDescription}

fields.label: Open Graph Image
fields.name: ogImage
fields.hint: Open Graph image settings.

fields.label: Use Custom OG Image
fields.name: ogUseCustomOgImage
fields.hint: Enable to use the custom image for Open Graph specified below. Otherwise, the SEO Image configured above will be used.

fields.label: Custom OG Image
fields.name: ogCustomImage
fields.hint: The overridden image for Open Graph. You must switch on Use Custom OG Image above for this to take effect. Facebook recommends a 1200×630 (1.91:1) and will crop the top and bottom of larger images.

fields.label: Custom OG Image Alt
fields.name: ogCustomImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom Open Graph image. This is for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Twitter Cards
fields.name: twitterCards
fields.hint: ↑ Settings for the Twitter Cards that are created when sharing your page on Twitter.

fields.label: Twitter Card Type
fields.name: twitterCardType
fields.hint: Choose the card type. Use Site-Wide Setting will use the site-wide setting specified in Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. You can override this by choosing another option here. Regular summary cards use a square image and place the image next to the content, while the summary card with large image places the image above the card's text.

fields.label: Twitter Card Title
fields.name: twitterCardTitle
fields.hint: The title shown when someone shares your page on Twitter. Use {siteWidePostTwitterCardTitle} for the computed Twitter Card title from Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentTwitterCardTitle}

fields.label: Twitter Card Description
fields.name: twitterCardDescription
fields.hint: The description shown when someone shares your page on Twitter. Use {siteWidePostTwitterCardDescription} for the computed Twitter Card description from Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentTwitterCardDescription}

fields.label: Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardImage
fields.hint: Twitter Card image settings.

fields.label: Use Custom Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardUseCustomImage
fields.hint: Enable to override the SEO Image (above) for Twitter Cards, specifying a different one below.

fields.label: Custom Twitter Card Image
fields.name: twitterCardCustomImage
fields.hint: The custom image for Twitter Cards. You must switch on Use Custom Twitter Card Image above for this to take effect. You should not use a generic image such as your website logo, author photo, or other image that spans multiple pages. Images for Summary Card support an aspect ratio of 1:1 with minimum dimensions of 144x144 or maximum of 4096x4096 pixels, and will be cropped to a square on all platforms. Images for Summary Card With Large Image support an aspect ratio of 2:1 with minimum dimensions of 300x157 or maximum of 4096x4096 pixels. Images must be less than 5MB in size. JPG, PNG, WEBP and GIF formats are supported. Only the first frame of an animated GIF will be used. SVG is not supported.

fields.label: Custom Twitter Card Image Alt
fields.name: twitterCardCustomImageAlt
fields.hint: A description of what's happening in the custom Twitter Card image. This is for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can know what's up. Supports template tags.

fields.label: Twitter Card Site Username
fields.name: twitterCardSiteUsername
fields.hint: The site username that the Twitter Card is attributed to, prefixed with the @ symbol. Use {siteWidePostTwitterCardSiteUsername} to specify the site username set in Site-Wide Post SEO Settings. Supports template tags. Template tag for this setting: {contentTwitterSiteUsername}
